subtitles.text: ♪ Music ♪
Good evening to all the listeners of J-WAVE WOW MUSIC.
My name is Seisaku, I sing and play bass in Mongol 800.
This week, we have started again.
WOW MUSIC, a music discussion among creators.
Last week we welcomed Kenta from Wanima.
Today, we welcome Ayunidi of Vish as our guest,
Today, we would like to bring you a late-night music discussion with Ayunidi from Vish.
The more I look into Ayunidi, the more I find out that she has a mysterious charm.
The more I look into Ayunidi, the more I find out about her, the more I want to dig deeper into her.
JWAVE WOW MUSICToday we welcome Ayunidi from BISH. Please give her my best regards.
My name is Iunidi from BISH. I'm Iunidi from BISH, and it's been a long time.
It's been a while.
It has been a long time.
It's been a long time.
I'm nervous. Me too. No, no, no, why are you nervous?
I'm more nervous than you. No, no, no.
But I was surprised to see you, you know, just the other day, you know. Yes, just the other day.
BiSH project. Yes.
For the event at Kagao. Yes.
Seisaku's solo. Yes.
A little bit at Cleré Gypsy.
I was invited. The two of us were able to go to Mombishi, which we had longed for. No, no, no, no, no, no, welcome back.
I was surprised because I didn't think that you would accept me already. I didn't think you would even do a session. I was very happy to be able to do it.
I'd like to talk a little bit about the pattern, or rather, the memories of that session, while digging back a little bit.
I would like to talk about various things related to music today, but first I would like to ask you about your musical roots,
When did you first become interested in music?
When did you first become interested in music?
When did you become interested in music?
It's really only recently, in the last few years.
After I joined Bishu and started working as a solo artist
I became more conscious of music for the first time.
I became more conscious of music.
To put it another way, before that, did you have any image of what music was?
No, I really didn't have any exposure to music or art when I was a child.
I played the piano a little bit when I was little.
But I was so scared of the teacher that I didn't want to go.
I would walk in the door and say I didn't want to go, and just quit.
Looking back, I really wish I had continued.
I think I really should have kept going.
I think I should have kept playing piano, but I had already given up on it.
I had an impression that I didn't like music at all.
I didn't listen to or watch anything, or have a favorite artist, or anything like that.
I didn't have a favorite artist or anything like that, I just listened to what was popular at school and heard it on the school broadcasts.
I only knew of bands that were really popular. I wanted to be an architect in the past.
An architect? I see.
I didn't know any music at all, but I had a feeling for Mr. Monpachi since I was a little kid.
It's played at school, right? I knew it, I knew it so well.
It's like a part of life.
Wait a minute. Let's get this straight.
I'm sorry.
I just saw the word "architecture" and it just popped out.
That's probably where I got the most out of it.
But that too has fallen by the wayside.
That's why I became a bish.
No, no, no.
It's interesting to see the video, but...
It's interesting to watch the video.
It's interesting to listen to it, but...
I'm sorry.
I wonder how you joined Bish.
My sister is a big fan of Bisch.
She used to travel all over the country for live shows.
But the girl who was her sister's favorite
The girl who was her favorite quit the group.
I saw on the internet that they were looking for a new member
I saw on the internet that they were looking for a new member
I applied for the audition and I got it.
And I got it.
Are you the most excited one?
Yes, I am.
I don't know what you're talking about.
I still understand it pretty well.
When did you want to become an architect?
When I was in high school.
When you were a student?
That's right.
I was learning how to build and design houses.
I was studying house building and design.
My hometown is in Hokkaido.
But when I was accepted into the fine arts program
I came to Tokyo.
From what you've said so far...
Is that why you started playing an instrument recently?
Yes, that's right.
I haven't sung for a few years.
I don't sing.
Really?
That's funny.
Can I ask you about one of your influences?
Tattoo Alley by Number Girl.
When I was doing my solo, I picked up my first instrument.
I was playing bass.
I invited Hisako Tabuchi of Number Girl to be my support guitarist.
She accepted my offer.
I met Hisako and she was a big part of my life.
That's why I chose this song.
Next, I would like to ask you about your live performances.
Bish is all about live performance.
Thank you very much.
Do you remember your first live performance after joining Bish?Do you remember your first live performance after joining Bish?
Yes, I do.
It was our debut live at ZEPP Tokyo.
It was a free concert.
It was a free live concert.
The last song was the unveiling of the new members.
The last song was the first song we played with the current 6 members.
It was called "Spark".
I was so nervous!
My armpits were all sweaty.
I was shaking.
My voice was shaking as we performed the song.
Just this one song at the show.
That was the first day, wasn't it?
But a few days later, we started a national tour.
With Bish, you're singing and dancing.
It's different from playing an instrument.
I didn't have to worry about playing the wrong song.
Well, I see.
I'm trying to do my best with the songs for now.
That's amazing!
It's quite nerve-wracking, though, isn't it?
What's more...
Yes, it is.
It's really the first time to perform live... or rather, to show it off to everyone.
That's almost true.
I opened a Twitter account about a month ago as a new member.
I opened a Twitter account about a month ago.
But I don't want to show my face unless I have more than 15,000 followers.
I was bish to do it in a way that I wouldn't show my face unless I had over 15,000 followers.
I was doing a Bish thing.
I think I went over 15,000 right away.
And then, I'd show a little glimpse of my face.
Just a glimpse.
As you know, Mr. Seisaku.
Bish is a very unique group of people.
I didn't talk to most of the members at the first show.
I was scared at the time.
How did you blend in?
No, it's just recently.
Of course.
It takes time, doesn't it?
What a surprise.
Members...
It's not easy to do things in a straight line, but you seem to be able to get through it with a smile.
It's hard to make a simple fix, but they seem to be able to get through it without a hitch.
The house and
Bisch is always associated with live performances.
I don't care if it's something you're aware of as Bisch, or if it's something you think of as Bisch.
What are you personally conscious of as a bish?
I think that live performances are the best place to show how you live your life.
I often put too much effort into every single moment in interviews, radio and TV.
I often put too much effort into every moment in interviews, on the radio, or on TV, but in a live performance, I feel I can be myself the most.
Bisch, each of you is a unique human being, and each of you has your own unique view of the world.
Each bish is a unique human being, and we respect each other's unique worldview.
I think it's a good thing that we don't interfere too much with each other while respecting each other's unique view of the world.
I think that's one of the best things about Bisch.
I think it's in the live performance that we can fully add this to the band.
I wasn't singing with an instrument because I had a passion for music.
I was aiming for architecture, and then suddenly I took a sharp turn and joined Bisch.
And now live performance is the way to go... it's really amazing!
It took me 6 years!
It took me 6 years to get here, but I'm very much in tune with myself now.
If I can say that, it's probably because
I'm sure I've done a lot of stupid things.
There are a lot of simple changes.
I couldn't distinguish the sound at all at first.
I couldn't tell which was the guitar sound and which was the drum sound...
But as I fell in love with music and started playing my own instruments
And as I started to play instruments and create things, I started to understand how the guitar sounded.
I started to understand how the guitar sounded in this song.
I started to understand what the guitar sounded like, and I started to enjoy the live performance more and more.
Can you tell us about one song that you thought was great at a live performance by an artist you've seen?
I'd like to know if there is one song that you thought was great at a live performance by an artist you've seen.
It's called "Mono no Kojo" and it's called "Heterojin".
I recently had the chance to see the band Mono no Kojo live at Liquid
I saw them live at Liquid.
It's like a dream you have when you have the flu.
Like a dream you have when you have the flu.
Chaotic, a little bit eerie
A little bit eerie, a little bit funny...
I was really struck by the fact that Bisch could never produce that kind of feeling.
It's funny, I'd like to hear just what you think of it now.
There were clowns and such in the production.
The world view was really cool!
I'd like to focus a little bit on your songwriting.
I'd like to focus on your songwriting.
And as a solo artist, there is Pedro.
Is there a difference in your creative activities?
Yes, there are.
I don't really think of myself as doing one thing this way and another thing that way.
I'm not conscious of doing this one this way or that one that way.
I'm just a woman.
I'm a woman, so my work reflects my life and what I've noticed before Unity.
I'm a woman, so what I've done in my life and what I've realized before Unity is reflected naturally in both of them.
In terms of music, I have a solo band project called Pedro.
I have my own instruments there.
I also compose my own music.
So the sense of songwriting is completely different.
With Vish, I think I'd like to sing with all six of us.I think I'd like to sing with the six of us in Vish.
I want to put words into it.
With Pedro, I want to sing about my own life.
or stories that I've made up on my own.
I can sing whatever I want without being shy.
I can sing by myself without worrying about anything else.
I think I can write without worrying about anything else.
When did you start writing lyrics?
I started writing lyrics about 6 years ago when I joined Vish.
That's when I started writing lyrics for the first time.
I started composing about 3 years ago when I started pedro.
I started composing when I started to play an instrument.
Did you choose a bass instrument out of the blue?
Oh, that's right.
The reason why I started playing solo is because the president of Vish's office asked me out of the blue.
The president of Vish's office called me out of the blue.
After Vish's concert, he asked me if I wanted to play solo.
He asked Ayu if she wanted to play with a band.
But the boss said if he wanted to do it, he should do it.
Before I could say "I can't do it if I don't have an instrument"...

I thought I'd take the bass, so I took the easy way out and chose it.
I think it's a choice that will get you into the swamp, for better or worse.
I think that choosing a bass guitar will be a long-term relationship in your musical life!

I chose it for some reason.

I think there is something else going on in my head.

but now I really like it.

When I was in Vish.

I learned the pain of making music, but I also learned the joy and happiness and feeling of the joy beyond the pain of making music.

Yes, the song "Beginning, End and Beginning" by Bish. I wrote the lyrics to this song, and it tells the story of the birth of Bish and the present.
I have written many songs about myself as a solo artist, but I have not written many songs about Bish as a noun.
So I wrote a song about the place where Bish was born, and also a song about what it's like to be one of the six of us.
Speaking of Bish, it was announced that the band will disband in 2023.
How do you feel nowadays? I think it's been a long but short half year.
I think it's been a long time, but it's been a very short time.
The fact that it was only inside Bish was only announced half a year ago this year.

I feel a little more at ease now.
Really...

I felt like I was lying a little.
I felt like I was doing something I shouldn't have done, but after we announced the breakup this year
After we announced the breakup of the group this year, I started to think about what I would eat and when I would die.

But since the announcement of our breakup this year, there is a big difference between eating a meal after you know when you're going to die and eating a meal when you don't know when you're going to die.
I want to cherish and treasure each day.
I know that.
